description:
8.69 bandpass
Apply a two-pole Butterworth band-pass filter with central
frequency frequency, and (3dB-point) band-width width.
The csg option selects a constant skirt gain (peak gain = Q)
instead of the default: constant 0dB peak gain.
The filter roll off at 6dB per octave (20dB per decade).

The filter accepts the following options:
name: bandpass

parameters.description: Set the filter’s central frequency. Default is 3000.
parameters.name: frequency, f

parameters.description: Constant skirt gain if set to 1. Defaults to 0.
parameters.name: csg

parameters.description:
Set method to specify band-width of filter.

h

Hz

q

Q-Factor

o

octave

s

slope

k

kHz
parameters.name: width_type, t

parameters.description: Specify the band-width of a filter in width_type units.
parameters.name: width, w

parameters.description: How much to use filtered signal in output. Default is 1. Range is between 0 and 1.
parameters.name: mix, m

parameters.description: Specify which channels to filter, by default all available are filtered.
parameters.name: channels, c

parameters.description: Normalize biquad coefficients, by default is disabled. Enabling it will normalize magnitude response at DC to 0dB.
parameters.name: normalize, n

parameters.description:
Set transform type of IIR filter.

di
dii
tdi
tdii
latt
svf
zdf
parameters.name: transform, a

parameters.description:
Set precision of filtering.

auto

Pick automatic sample format depending on surround filters.

s16

Always use signed 16-bit.

s32

Always use signed 32-bit.

f32

Always use float 32-bit.

f64

Always use float 64-bit.
parameters.name: precision, r

parameters.description:
Set block size used for reverse IIR processing. If this value is set to high enough value (higher than impulse response length truncated when reaches near zero values) filtering will become linear phase otherwise if not big enough it will just produce nasty artifacts.

Note that filter delay will be exactly this many samples when set to non-zero value.
parameters.name: block_size, b
